name: Moth Orchid
alias: Moth Orchid, Phals
description: An absolute classic, yet so often misunderstood. Once you get to know their unique needs and can read their handy cues, enjoying these beauties will be a breeze. The foliage is pleasantly unassuming and the tangle of aerial roots are curious, but the star of the show is the cluster of blooms that sits atop a long arching stem. True to their name, each bloom looks almost like a moth captured in mid-flight.
format: Aerial roots, thick green leaves, and clusters of bright blooms.
leaf_shape: Bright green oblong leaves featuring showy blooms.

name: Nerve Plant
alias: Mosaic Plant, Fittonia, Painted Net Leaf
description: This little plant packs a punch. Their bright green leaves are strongly contrasted by veins in brilliant white, pink, or red that creates the look of an intricate mosaic with contrasting grout or a depiction of the nervous system.
format: Low bushy clusters of densely packed stems.
leaf_shape: Deep green with high contrast veins and an almond shape.

name: Croton
alias: Fire Croton, Garden Croton, Variegated Croton, Joseph's Coat
description: With a fiery burst of color and texture, this croton is a true stand out. Their squiggly oblong leaves are splashed with joyful flecks of green, yellow, orange, and red that create a spectacular flame effect.
format: Densely packed upright stems.
leaf_shape: Vibrant multi-colored leaves with a wavy oblong shape.

name: Pencil Cactus
alias: Indian Tree Spurge, Pencil Tree, Milk Bush, Fire Sticks, Sticks on Fire, Aveloz
description: A strange plant that might seem more at home in a coral reef. The tangle of stems and branches have a uniform thickness that happens to resemble a pencilâhence the name! But another name, Fire Sticks, hints at a show-stopping ability to change color. The stems can shift from a vibrant green to yellow, orange, and pink!
format: Dense clusters of many-branched stems.
leaf_shape: Tiny unremarkable leaves stud dense, plentiful stems.

name: Burro's Tail
alias: Donkey's Tail, Lamb's Tail
description: An irresistibly cute succulent. Rows of chubby little leaves are densely layered along cascading stems, creating long "tails" that lend quite a mane-like look to the whole affair.
format: Cascading tendrils create a mane-like look.
leaf_shape: Plump vibrant green teardrops.

name: Bird of Paradise
alias: Crane Flower
description: Instant jungle! The Bird of Paradise is named for the eye-catching flowers it can produce (with enough light and TLC), but the vibrant green and extra large leaves fan out and make a bold statement all on their own.
format: Upright clusters of long stems.
leaf_shape: Deep green with a paddle-like shape.

name: Stromanthe Triostar
alias: Triostar, Calathea Triostar
description: A perky plant in cheerful shades of pink and green. The variegation has an artistic qualityâeach leaf seems to be painted in deliberate, broad brushstrokes. Often mistaken for their cousin, the Calathea, this Stromanthe shares the ability to raise and lower their leaves from night to day.
format: Low bushy clusters of densely packed stems.
leaf_shape: Slender leaves with a unique painterly pattern.

name: Mini Monstera
alias: Monstera Minima, Philodendron Minima
description: A highly coveted addition for many plant lovers. This beauty is often mistaken for a mini version of the prolific Monstera deliciosa. And while they share a similar look and climbing ability, the splits on Raphidophora leaves seem to have a more consistent pattern, creating a more elegant, graceful look. A tad less wild, but still plenty of jungle vibes.
format: A low shrubby plant that vines to great lengths.
leaf_shape: Bright green with deeply split edges.

name: Oxalis
alias: Purple Shamrock, False Shamrock, Love Plant, Wood Sorrel, Black Oxalis
description: A petite plant pal that'll stop you in your tracks. The crisp triangular leaves emerge from their stem in trios. Their otherworldly quality is enhanced by their deep, almost black, purple color. Not to mention the dainty pinkish-white flowers that you might spot peaking up through the dense foliage.
format: Low bushy clusters of densely packed stems.
leaf_shape: Bundles of triangular leaflets in a dark purple hue.

name: Yucca
alias: Yucca elephantipes, Yucca guatemalensis, Yucca Cane, Spineless Yucca, Giant Yucca
description: Spiky sword-like blades burst out from the tops of chunky cane-like branches on these unique indoor trees. Sometimes mistaken for a type of palm, these striking houseplants are slow growers that will nevertheless take up quite a bit of spaceâthe perfect anchor for a bright corner in your home.
format: Upright tree-like formation.
leaf_shape: Flat spears in bright green.

name: Caladium
alias: Elephant Ear, Heart of Jesus, Angel Wings
description: Delicate heart-shaped leaves with an ephemeral quality. This variety sports pale green, almost white leaves with an intricate pattern of veins in a vibrant green. But perhaps most strikingâthe midline and primary veins are stained pink, seemingly "bleeding" out into each leaf.
format: Upright clusters of long stems.
leaf_shape: Delicate heart-shaped leaves with highly contrasted venation.

name: Monstera
alias: Swiss Cheese Plant, Fruit Salad Plant, Split-leaf Philodendron
description: Likely the most recognizable houseplantâMonstera are widely admired for their glossy green split leaves with fenestrations (holes), but equally appreciated for their easy going ways. Monstera are happiest (and grow bigger leaves) when given the opportunity to climb.
format: Densely packed upright stems.
leaf_shape: Bright green and heart-shaped with splits and perforations.

name: Chinese Evergreen
alias: Aglaonema, Philippine Evergreen
description: A pleasantly bushy and easy going plant. Densely packed stems are topped with graceful oblong leaves that radiate out in all directions. Each deep green leaf has a unique pattern of contrasting splotches in a much lighter, almost white, shade of green.
format: Densely packed upright stems.
leaf_shape: Deep green with variegation and an elongated teardrop shape.

name: Ficus Audrey
alias: Bengal Fig, Strangler Fig, Banyan Tree, Peepal, Bahupada
description: Soft shapes and soft to the touch! This friendly ficus is a bit easier to take care of than their more ubiquitous cousin, the FLF, but equally capable of making a statement in your space. Generally potted in groups of a few stems, this elegant plant looks just as nice whether a petite, bush-like plant or a stately tree branching out and up!
format: Can be trained into a single trunk tree-form.
leaf_shape: Bright green in a soft almond shape.

name: Coral Cactus
alias: Crested Elkhorn, Crested Candelabra Plant, Crested Euphorbia
description: This unusual plant is actually two-plants-in-one! The base, or "trunk", is (usually) a Euphorbia neriifolia and the top is a Euphorbia lactea that has been grafted on, creating a curious Frankenstein plant that closely resembles something you might find in a coral reef!
format: A slender trunk topped with a crested formation.
leaf_shape: Rippled wavy crest formation.

name: Hindu Rope Plant
alias: Hoya Compacta, Krinkle Kurl, Indian Rope, Angel Rope, Porcelain Flower, Wax Plant
description: Quite a unique vining plant, distinguished for their curled, twisted, somewhat gnarled-looking leaves. These waxy plump leaves grow in dense succession, creating a rope-like effect as they trail longer and longer. A high shelf or hanging planter is perfect for displaying these trailing tendrils.
format: Cascading tendrils create a mane-like look.
leaf_shape: Two-toned green and a scrunched, twisted shape.

name: Desert Rose
alias: Sabi Star, Kudu, Mock Azalea, Impala Lily
description: An unusual little plant that unexpectedly boasts plentiful flowers. The Desert Rose is distinguished by its plump swollen stem (called a caudex) topped by a tangle of thick, stubby branches with bundles of small green leaves and studded with impressively pink blooms in the spring and summer.
format: Upright tree-like formation.
leaf_shape: Bright green leaf bundles.

name: Pilea
alias: Chinese Money Plant, Pancake Plant, Coin Plant, UFO Plant, Friendship Plant
description: This perky little plant is a delight for both their cute round leaves and a penchant for producing plantlets (pups) that are easily propagatedâthe reason they're also known as the "friendship plant".
format: Upright stem with a globular growth pattern.
leaf_shape: Vivid green in a perfectly round pad-like shape.

name: Money Tree
alias: Braided Money Tree, Guiana Chestnut, Saba Nut
description: Often sold with a decoratively braided trunk, this pretty indoor tree is thought to bring good fortune, but we'd like the Money Tree even if that wasn't the case. The bright green palm shaped leaves bring a perky, cheerful vibe to your home.
format: Upright tree-like formation.
leaf_shape: Bright green palmate leaf bundles.

name: Monstera Adansonii
alias: Swiss Cheese Vine, Monkey Mask
description: A petite cousin of the classic Monstera deliciosa. With the many holed leaves, this plant is also known as the Swiss Cheese Vine. Like their cousin, this plant is a natural climber, but will also cascade over the side of their containerâperfect for a high shelf or hanging planter.
format: A low shrubby plant that vines to great lengths.
leaf_shape: Bright green and teardrop shaped with numerous perforations.

name: Snake Plant
alias: Sansevieria, Mother-in-law's Tongue, Viper's Bowstring Hemp, Saint George's Sword, Tiger's Tail
description: All snake plants are known for their long, pointy spear or sword shaped leaves, but the Laurentii variant is distinguished by the unique streaky static-like variegation and striking yellow edges.
format: Densely packed upright leaves.
leaf_shape: Flat spears in bright green with variegation.

name: Heartleaf Philodendron
alias: Sweetheart Plant, Devil's Ivy, 'Cordatum'
description: A tried and true houseplant classic. Perfectly heart shaped bright green leaves adorn this sturdy vining (or climbing!) plant. Sometimes mistaken for a Pothos, you can distinguish the Heartleaf Philo by the distinct point in each leaf and their thinner, more delicate texture.
format: A low shrubby plant that vines to great lengths.
leaf_shape: Deep green with a heart shape.

name: ZZ Plant
alias: Zanzibar Gem, Zuzu Plant, Emerald Palm, Aroid Palm
description: A ZZ plant stands out with their petite leaflets lining tall sturdy swollen stems. The thick leaves are so glossy and bright that the ZZ can be mistaken for a faux plant! Which isn't really a bad thing as this plant thrives on neglect.
format: Upright clusters of long stems.
leaf_shape: Glossy emerald green with an almond shape.

name: Anthurium
alias: Flamingo Flower, Tail Flower, Laceleaf
description: Prized for their heart shaped green leaves and the showy pop of color from the long lasting spathes (often confused for flower petals, these are modified leaves) with their funny spike, or spadix.
format: Densely packed upright stems.
leaf_shape: Bright green and heart-shaped with a unique inflorescence.

name: Spider Plant
alias: Airplane Plant, St. Bernard's Lily, Spider Ivy, Ribbon Plant
description: An absolute classic. The Spider Plant is beloved for their easy going nature and ability to produce spiderettes, or little mini spider plants, that are ready to propagate at will.
format: Cascading leaves create a mane-like look.
leaf_shape: Long ribbon-like blades in bright green with a white stripe.

name: Fiddle Leaf Fig
alias: Fiddle, Fiddle Leaf, FLF, Fiddly Fig
description: The Fiddle Leaf Fig is a veritable houseplant icon. Admired for their stately tree-like form with distinctly lobed leaves that resemble a violin (their namesake, a fiddle). The prominent veins and cheerful, bright green hue of the leaves also contribute to their striking appearance.
format: Can be trained into a single trunk tree-form.
leaf_shape: Brilliant green with a large violin shape.

name: Rubber Tree
alias: Rubber Fig, Rubber Bush, Rubber Plant, Indian Rubber Plant, Indian Rubber Tree
description: Sturdy, leathery leaves that range from a striking deep dark green to burgundy black make the Rubber Tree a standout plant. Generally potted in groups of a few stems, this elegant plant looks just as nice whether a petite, bush-like plant or a stately tree branching out and up!
format: Can be trained into a single trunk tree-form.
leaf_shape: Glossy dark green with an almond shape.

name: Calathea Medallion
alias: Prayer Plant
description: Show-stopping leaves on this one! This Calathea has big round leaves with a frilly ridged texture. The leaves are graced with painterly brush strokes in various shades of green, while the undersides are a vibrant magenta.
format: Low bushy clusters of densely packed stems.
leaf_shape: Round leaves with ridges and a painterly pattern.

name: Calathea Rattlesnake
alias: Prayer Plant
description: The unusual leaf pattern of alternating small and large spots rivals any animal print out there. This Calathea also features slender frilly edged leaves with bright magenta undersides.
format: Low bushy clusters of densely packed stems.
leaf_shape: Slender leaves with ridges and a unique pattern.

name: Calathea Orbifolia
alias: Prayer Plant
description: Huge shiny round leaves with slivery green stripes radiating outward make this a particularly captivating Calathea! The large leaves make their "prayer" action all the more dramatic, lifting and lowering their leaves from night to day.
format: Low bushy clusters of densely packed stems.
leaf_shape: Large round leaves with ridges and a stripe pattern.

name: Maranta
alias: Prayer Plant, Herringbone Plant
description: The variegated green leaves with bright red veining and undersides make this prayer plant a standout. A variant known as 'Lemon Lime' trades the red for bright neon green! A low creeping plant, they really shine on a high shelf or hanging planter!
format: Low bushy clusters of densely packed stems.
leaf_shape: Oval leaves in shades of green with a herringbone pattern.

name: Golden Pothos
alias: Devil's Ivy, Sweetheart Vine, Ceylon Creeper, Hunter's Robe
description: Fast growing and easy going, Pothos are one of the most popular houseplants around. While there are many beautiful variants, this Golden Pothos stands out with fun yellow variegation. All Pothos will trail, but they can also climb if provided a little support or training.
format: A low shrubby plant that vines to great lengths.
leaf_shape: Vibrant green with variegation and a heart shape.

name: Parlor Palm
alias: Neanthe Bella Palm, Victorian Palm, Good Luck Palm
description: The simple elegance of this feathery palm is hard to deny. Generally grown in bundles or clumpsâeven a small specimen will have a pleasant bushy look. More mature specimens are sure to anchor any space with their tall fronds, parlor or not!
format: Densely packed upright stems.
leaf_shape: Feathery green fronds.

name: Alocasia Polly
official_name: N/A, but known as Alocasia Amazonica
alias: Amazon Elephant's Ear, African Mask
description: This Alocasia brings the drama! With frilly arrowhead shaped leaves in a deep dark green with highly contrasted veining and rich purple undersides! The unusual look is a striking addition to any plant fam.
format: Upright clusters of long stems.
leaf_shape: Dark green with a ruffled arrowhead shape.

name: Ponytail Palm
alias: Elephant's Foot, Bottle Palm
description: A sassy looking plant, indeed! The Ponytail Palm (though not actually a palm) is distinguished by its plump swollen stem (called a caudex) topped by a bundle of flowing slender and often curly leavesânot unlike a ponytail!
format: Upright tree-like formation.
leaf_shape: Long ribbon-like blades in a bright green.

name: Dracaena
alias: Dragon Tree, Madagascar Dragon Tree
description: The spiky grass-like blades that fountain out from the tops of wavy branches on these indoor trees make for an eye-catching houseplant. Sometimes mistaken for a type of palm, these Dracaena are actually related to Snake Plants and Yucca!
format: Upright tree-like formation.
leaf_shape: Long ribbon-like blades in green with a red margin.

name: Schefflera
alias: Umbrella Plant, Dwarf Schefflera, Gold Capella
description: A unique plant with their small palm-shaped leaf bundles radiating out like little bursts of green (and sometimes splashes of yellow if you have a variegated specimen). You can find this plant as a petite bush-like plant or an impressive tree growing to great heights!
format: Can be trained into a single trunk tree-form.
leaf_shape: Bright green palmate leaf bundles.

name: Dieffenbachia
alias: Dumb Cane
description: Large teardrop leaves in bright green with showy yellow flecks and splatters that emerge from a sturdy cane-like stalk. A fast growing friend, watching the Dieffenbachia transform year over year can be quite rewarding.
format: Upright cane-like stalks.
leaf_shape: Bright green with variegation and a large teardrop shape.

name: Philodendron Selloum
alias: Lacy Tree, Philodendron Hope, Philodendron Lickety-Split
description: A big frilly floppy split leaf graces this Philodendron! This tropical plant can be found in massive proportions in the wild and they are equally impressive (albeit smaller) indoors. A commonly sold hybrid was named 'Lickety-Split', which we think fits perfectly!
format: Densely packed, outward reaching stems.
leaf_shape: Bright green with deeply lobed frilly edges.

name: Alocasia Calidora
alias: Elephant's Ear, Persian Palm
description: This large leafed plant friend is sure to bring some serious jungle vibes to your space. The fun frilly arrowhead shaped leaves are a brilliant shade of bright green that like to point up towards the sun!
format: Upright clusters of long stems.
leaf_shape: Bright green with a ruffled arrowhead shape.

name: Tricolor Hoya
alias: Wax Plant, Wax Vine, Porcelain Flower
description: Plump waxy leaves that are green on the edges with light green to almost white in the center. You may also notice some leaves with a pinkish hue! A high shelf or hanging planter is perfect for displaying their trailing tendrils.
format: Cascading tendrils create a mane-like look.
leaf_shape: Bright green with variegation and a petite almond shape.

name: Spotted Begonia
alias: Polka Dot Begonia, Trout Begonia, Angel Wing Begonia, 'Wightii'
description: Quite a cheery little plant. Known for their 'angel wing' leaves with the cutest silver polka dots and red undersides! These are cane-type begonias, which means they grow on upright stems, generally in clusters or clumps and can grow quite tall!
format: Upright cane-like stalks.
leaf_shape: Olive green with polka dots and angel-wing shape.

name: String of Dolphins
alias: Dolphin Necklace, Dolphin Plant, Flying Dolphins
description: A cutie for sure! Named for the adorable little leaves that look like dolphins jumping out of the water! These gorgeous cascading stems are perfect for a high shelf or a hanging planter.
format: Cascading tendrils create a mane-like look.
leaf_shape: Plump vibrant green, shaped like dolphins.

name: String of Hearts
alias: Chain of Hearts, Rosary Vine, Heart Vine
description: Distinguished for their garland-like trailing stems with adorable little leaves that resemble hearts! The coloration can vary from solid green (often with contrasting veining) to a green/white marbled look on the front and a delightful pink hue on the back.
format: Cascading tendrils create a mane-like look.
leaf_shape: Rounded hearts in a variegated green.

name: Fishbone Cactus
alias: Zig Zag Cactus, Ric Rac Cactus
description: Quite a unique trailing houseplant, the Fishbone Cactus is distinguished by leaves that grow in a wonderfully wiggly zig zag pattern! They shoot straight up and then curve down as they grow longer and longer.
format: Cascading tendrils create a mane-like look.
leaf_shape: Vibrant green tendrils in a zig-zag shape.

name: Peace Lily
alias: Spath Lily
description: A pleasantly lush cluster of vibrant green leaves create the perfect backdrop for the elegant white blooms that peek out in spring (with a bonus appearance in the fall)... and can stick around for quite awhile.
format: Densely packed upright stems.
leaf_shape: Bright green with an elongated teardrop shape and a white inflorescence.

name: Aloe Plant
alias: Aloe barbadensis
description: A lovely rosette of spear-like leaves fan out from a central stem. This particularly easy going succulent sports extra plump leaves that contain a first-aid bonus inside. The watery gel in each spear can provide quick relief for burns or bites.
format: Densely packed upright leaves.
leaf_shape: Plump green or blue-green spears with serrated edges.

name: Boston Fern
alias: Sword Fern, Ladder Fern, Boss Fern
description: One of the most popular ferns and for good reason - the delicately textured fronds create a particularly fluffy and lush look that is hard to resist and will certainly sit pretty in a hanging planter or high shelf. Not to mention those Jurassic forest vibes.
format: Cascading tendrils create a mane-like look.
leaf_shape: Fluffy green fronds.

name: Watermelon Peperomia
alias: Watermelon Begonia
description: A simply adorable little plant whose leaves strike an uncanny resemblance to the rind of a watermelon. This petite, but bushy plant will stand out all on its own or cozied up to a few friends.
format: Low bushy clusters of densely packed stems.
leaf_shape: Thick round leaves with a stripe pattern.

name: Tradescantia Nanouk
alias: Spiderwort, Inch Plant, Fantasy Venice, Wandering Jew (or Dude)
description: A striking plant whose colors and patterns bring a dash of delight to any plant fam. The pretty leaves stack up on an upright stem that will eventually cascade over the planter. The shock of bright, almost neon, magenta on the underside of each leaf gets us every time!
format: Low bushy clusters of densely packed stems.
leaf_shape: Vibrant colors and striations on petite almond-shaped leaves.

name: Satin Pothos
alias: Silk Pothos, Silver Pothos, Silver Philodendron, Silver Vine, Silver Cloud
description: An understated beauty whose elegant grey-green leaves and silvery spots shimmer in the light as they tumble down in long vines. But those vines will also climb if provided a little support or training.
format: A low shrubby plant that vines to great lengths.
leaf_shape: Grey-green with spotted variegation and a heart shape.

name: Starfish Snake Plant
alias: African Spear Plant, Cylindrical Snake Plant, Spear Sansevieria, Spear Orchid
description: This snake plant is distinguished by their chubby spear-like leaves that splay out to resemble a starfish. Often potted in multiples, the aquatic effect can be quite striking.
format: Densely packed upright leaves.
leaf_shape: Cylindrical spears in bright green with variegation.

name: African Milk Tree
alias: African Milk Bush, Cathedral Cactus, Abyssinian Euphorbia, High Chaparral, Friendship Cactus
description: One of the most whimsical plants we've encountered. The central stem and clusters of "arms" create a tree-like look, while each stem is studded with rows of leaves that stick out and remind us of an aquatic creature and/or alien. This particular variety is also accented with a tinge of red!
format: A central upright stem with multiple branches or "arms".
leaf_shape: Perky little leaves with a teardrop shape.

name: Bird's Nest Fern
alias: Nest Fern
description: A bit of a wild-child, this fern's playfully ruffled fronds create a tangle that resembles a bird's nest. Some say the fuzzy buds of new growth that are yet to be unfurled have the look eggs nestled at the center of the plant.
format: Low bushy clusters of densely packed stems.
leaf_shape: Slender leaves with a wavy texture.

name: English Ivy
alias: European Ivy, Ivy
description: Ivy is often thought of for their ability to either give the side of your house a distinguished collegiate look or invade your entire yard. But as a houseplant, the lovely tangle of vines is a welcome addition to any collection (and much easier to manage).
format: A low shrubby plant that vines to great lengths.
leaf_shape: Deep green palmate leaves.
